trigger_event: Across Stenograd, as grassroots cooperatives flourish and the BCI breaks down, neighborhoods report cases where people swap identities, memories, and privileges overnight. Rumors swirl about a hidden protocol Halden embedded, pushing the city into an identity crisis—forcing the Council and its advisors, including Sven, to act.
dilemma: Should Sven urge the Council to embrace this new era of unpredictable, shared identities as an opportunity for radical empathy and transformation, or demand a firm reset, rallying citizens around a dramatic countdown to force a quick, collective decision?
reason: The city teeters between hope and chaos. Sven is torn between rewarding this surge of collective spirit and fearing it spirals into confusion or collapse. His strategic messaging will decide whether Stenograd experiments with newfound empathy or resets under duress.
choice_a: Frame the blending of identities and BCI boundaries as a rare gift and convince leaders and citizens to cherish and build upon this moment, guiding the city toward a gentler, collective-led order.
belief_a: Change, even when messy, is the birth of progress.
Human connection matters more than tidy rules.
Crisis can be a bridge, not just a breaking point.
choice_b: Sound the alarm, declaring the situation unsustainable, and orchestrate a dramatic countdown to BCI shutdown—gambling that pressure will force the city to unite behind a new, inclusive charter before collapse.
belief_b: Order forged in urgency breeds true consensus.
Clarity requires confronting crisis, not drifting through it.
Transformation means letting go of the past, even harshly.
